name: Breadcrumb
description: Navigation component displaying hierarchical path links to help users understand their current location within a website's hierarchy and provide navigation paths to higher-level pages.

active_is_link.description: Whether to show the active (current page) element as a clickable link

links.description: Array of breadcrumb navigation links representing the hierarchical path

text.description: Display text for the breadcrumb link

url.description: URL destination for the breadcrumb link

attributes.description: Additional HTML attributes to be applied to the nav element

modifier_class.description: Additional CSS classes for styling customization

examples.name: Basic Breadcrumb
examples.description: Standard breadcrumb with three levels of hierarchy

examples.name: Active as Link
examples.description: Breadcrumb where current page is also a clickable link

when_to_use: Website or application has hierarchical structure with multiple navigation levels
Users need to understand their location within site structure
Quick navigation to parent or higher-level pages is needed
Users might need to backtrack or move laterally through site structure
Content is more than three levels deep from homepage
when_not_to_use: Website has flat structure with no clear hierarchy
Site has very few pages and simple navigation structure
Navigation paths would be redundant with other prominent navigation elements
Page is already at highest level of site hierarchy (homepage)
Site structure is very complex with many possible paths to same content
best_practices: Represent the true hierarchy accurately reflecting site's information architecture
Always include homepage as first item establishing clear starting point
Make breadcrumbs clickable except for current page
Use consistent visual separators between breadcrumb items
Visually distinguish current page (non-clickable, bold, or different color)
Maintain consistent placement across all pages
Adapt breadcrumbs for smaller screens with truncation or parent-only display
Limit breadcrumb levels for very deep hierarchies

attributes.name: aria-current
attributes.description: Indicates the current location within a set of related elements

mobile.behavior: Shows simplified breadcrumb with only immediate parent page link (back button style)

desktop.behavior: Shows full breadcrumb trail with all hierarchy levels

known_issues: Mobile truncation limitations for very deep hierarchies
Screen reader experience could be further optimized
Integration with search results may not always display optimal paths

findings: Breadcrumbs enhance wayfinding and reduce disorientation in complex websites
Breadcrumbs reduce number of actions required to navigate to higher-level pages
Users typically understand breadcrumb trails without explicit instruction
Simplified mobile version follows research-backed principles about conserving space
